title: Textile, "Layla and Majnun", 16th–17th century
medium:
Medium: silk, metallic threads
Technique: two intercrossed plain weave structures (double cloth)
description: Fragment of woven silk shaped as if part of a skirt, with figures of a boy holding a deer and woman on either side of a flowering tree. Figures in cream, repeated in mirror image in alternating rows, alternating with rows of leaping gazelles, on a ribbed ground of red and silver.

tombstone.epitaph:
Textile, "Layla and Majnun", 16th–17th century.
16th–17th century. Medium: silk, metallic threads
Technique: two intercrossed plain weave structures (double cloth). Gift of John Pierpont Morgan. 1902-1-379.
